channel.title: "Open Containing Folder" From TBB's 'Downloads' Tab Fails
channel.description:
Qubes 4.0, Whonix 13, TBB 7.5.6. Occuring in both Whonix-WS and Whonix-DispVM. For some reason Gwenview is called instead of Dolphin, giving many AppArmor errors and complaints from Gwenview. What do I need to do to fix this?
Here are the results from Gwenview:
> Unable to save bookmarks in /home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/.kde/share/apps/kfileplaces/bookmarks.xml. Reported error was: Unable to open temporary file. Error was: 5.. This error message will only be shown once. The cause of the error needs to be fixed as quickly as possible, which is most likely a full hard drive.
> "URL cannot be listed file:///home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/Downloads"

item.title: "Open Containing Folder" From TBB's 'Downloads' Tab Fails
item.dc:creator: 9jnc7
item.description:
Ignorance. I didn’t know how to make it work and didn’t feel like reading anything to find out how.

Thanks @0brand

Read full topic
item.source: "Open Containing Folder" From TBB's 'Downloads' Tab Fails

item.title: "Open Containing Folder" From TBB's 'Downloads' Tab Fails

item.description:
Everything works fine in Whonix 14 and Debian, although Debian doesn’t have Gwenview installed. Whonix-14-dvm won’t cooperate with me, but it’s alright.

item.title: "Open Containing Folder" From TBB's 'Downloads' Tab Fails
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Since Whonix 14 will be released very soon, this bug report will be rejected for Whonix 13.

https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-14-release-blockers-status-of-whonix-14-development

Could you try in Whonix 14 please?

And could you compare please with TBB inside a Debian template?

(as per https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#Tor_Browser_Functionality_on_Different_Platforms)

Read full topic
item.source: "Open Containing Folder" From TBB's 'Downloads' Tab Fails

item.title: "Open Containing Folder" From TBB's 'Downloads' Tab Fails
item.dc:creator: 9jnc7
item.description:
Qubes 4.0, Whonix 13, TBB 7.5.6. Occuring in both Whonix-WS and Whonix-DispVM. For some reason Gwenview is called instead of Dolphin, giving many AppArmor errors and complaints from Gwenview. What do I need to do to fix this?

Here are the results from Gwenview:

Unable to save bookmarks in /home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/.kde/share/apps/kfileplaces/bookmarks.xml. Reported error was: Unable to open temporary file. Error was: 5… This error message will only be shown once. The cause of the error needs to be fixed as quickly as possible, which is most likely a full hard drive.

“URL cannot be listed
file:///home/user/.tb/tor-browser/Browser/Downloads”

Read full topic
